Description: Clay disc made of Nile clay with quite a lot voids from organic temper. The clay was fired and is very hard and might therefore be overfired or originate from the core of a sherd. The object was shaped into a round and flat disc with a lot of scratches on one surface that was well smoothed as well as on the edges. The other side shows two incised parallel line, one through the centre and another close to the edge of the object. In the middle with the incised line a thin crack can be seen. The object is pierced in the middle, over two thirds of the perforation were drilled from one side before the object was turned over. The perforation has an inner diameter of 0.7 cm, an outer diameter of 1.0 cm. Possible use as a spindle whorl.
